content: Wander through the streets of Millvale to celebrate the arts with two days of free live music and performances.

Experience the best of Pittsburgh's arts scene at the annualMillvale Music Festival. This vibrantneighborhoodcelebration transforms the streets ofMillvaleinto an electrifying hub ofarts and culturefor two days. With over 300 musical acts, art for sale by local artists, stand-up comedy, spoken word performances, and a variety of food trucks, this free festival has quickly become a can’t miss event for locals.

The Millvale Music Festival is a FREE festival held at different bars, breweries, outdoor spaces, and community centers in the Millvale neighborhood of Pittsburgh. This year’s festival is onFriday, May 17thandSaturday, May 18th, 2024.

There will be over 300 local bands and musicians, visual artists, comedians, spoken word performances, and food trucks at the festival. For the most up to date lineup, visit the officialMillvale Music Festival website.

Plan out your music festival experience by downloading the official Millvale Music Festival app in advance (App StoreandGoogle Play). Create your own schedule, view the event map, and learn about this year’s performers and artists.
Millvale Music Festival is an outdoor event that will have you walking throughout the neighborhood to enjoy different performances. To ensure you have a great time, bring along these items:
Snap a great photo during the festival?
Share it with#lovePGHand#MMF24.

There are manydifferent ways to get to the festivalincluding driving, ride shares, biking, and public transit. Street parking will be very limited and arriving via an alternative method is highly recommended. To travel viapublic transittake routes that connect the 1 to Tarentum, the 2 to Mount Royal, and stops north on Evergreen.

Bikingto the festival is a great way to travel! Millvale Music Festival has partnered withBikePGHsince 2022 to provide extra bike racks at multiple points throughout the festival. The festival is also accessible via theThree Rivers Heritage Trailthrough the Millvale Riverfront Park, with multiple public parking lots along the trail.
